item.title: Pokemon Masters EX: What is Pasio Towers & How Does it Work?
item.description:
Pokemon Master EX has received a new feature for players to enjoy during July 2025 . This feature is a new gameplay mode known as the Pasio Towers , which provides a fun and challenging goal for players to participate in and earn rewards from.

Pasio Towers went live in Pokemon Masters EX on June 28, 2025 , bringing eighteen different towers for players to work their way through in battle. By completing towers in the Pasio Towers mode, players can earn numerous rewards such as valuable Story Keys for unlocking side stories, and Plaques of Perfection, enabling Trainers to raise Sync Pairs up to level 200. If you're wondering how to unlock Pasio Towers, how participation works, and what rewards can be gained in Pokemon Masters EX , all relevant information has been outlined in the guide below.

Pokemon Masters EX Pasio Towers Guide

Pasio Towers is the latest mode to be implemented in Pokemon Master EX . This mode takes the approach of a tower-climbing goal that is capable of testing new trainers and veterans alike. Pasio Towers cover all eighteen Pokemon Types, with each having their own tower featuring up to thirty floors with increasing difficulty. Trainers will match a Synch Pair to the Tower's Type theme, then climb as high as possible to earn rewards.

How to Enter Pasio Towers in Pokemon Masters EX

  • To access a tower, you'll need a Tower Pass, which can be obtained through gifts or special events . Once you have a Tower Pass, you'll have multiple attempts to clear each floor as you progress upward.
  • Each tower floor consumes an attempt once you complete it. Attempts regenerate every eight hours, and a player can stock and hold up to 20 attempts at a time.
  • Each Tower is themed around a specific Pokemon Type, and you can only use monsters that match that same Type.
  • As you climb each floor, you will encounter unique restrictions such as bans on certain move categories.

All Pasio Tower Floor Rewards in Pokemon Masters EX

  • Finishing a tower for the first time grants a one-time bonus of 100 Gems along with a special item. Beyond that, for every 10 floors you successfully complete across all towers, you'll earn either a Certificate of Excellence or a Plaque of Excellence as a milestone reward.

item.title: 8 Best Roblox Games For Beginners, Ranked
item.description:
Summary

  • Roblox offers beginner-friendly games like Royale High for fantasy role-playing fun.
  • Players can explore serene underwater worlds in games like Scuba Diving at Quill Lake for low-stress adventures.
  • Beginners can start with games like Hide and Seek Extreme for immediate fun and Natural Disaster Survival for quick decision-making challenges.

Entering Roblox for the first time is like walking into a digital metropolis where every door leads to a different universe. With over 40 million user-created worlds, the platform has completely redefined what it means to “start gaming,” offering a sprawling collection of genres, social hangouts, and creative outlets that can feel both thrilling and overwhelming.

With thousands of games available, beginners need more than just something “easy.” They need a welcoming experience that actually shows what makes Roblox tick. Each of these beginner-friendly Roblox games offers its own unique flavor of fun and community, ensuring that every new player finds a place to belong. This ranking of the eight best Roblox games for beginners spotlights the titles where new players learn the ropes, meet friends, and discover why millions log in every day.

8 Royale High

Dress Up and Dream Big in Fantasy

  • Creator: callmehbob
  • Game Link

Royale High transports players to a magical boarding school set in a world of enchanted castles and cosmic dormitories, offering a deep, high-fantasy role-playing experience. At its core, the game is an intricate avatar simulator that focuses on dressing up, socializing, and collecting rare cosmetic items. Players earn Diamonds by attending whimsical classes and completing daily tasks, then use that currency to snag new clothes, accessories, or dorm furniture.

It’s a game built for creative self-expression, packed with seasonal updates and community-driven metagames. The sprawling campus, currency farming, and multistep quests demand a little exploration and patience. However, new players do get plenty of nudges (on-screen tutorials for the basics), but the deeper economic and fashion strategies mostly come from the community. For those willing to put in the time, Royale High becomes a long-term hobby with endless customization and endless fun.

7 Scuba Diving at Quill Lake

Chill Underwater Quests for Curious Explorers

  • Creator: ColonelGraff
  • Game Link

For newcomers who prefer a focused, low-stress adventure, Scuba Diving at Quill Lake is a perfect starting point. This game offers a serene yet compelling experience centered on exploration and discovery in a tranquil underwater world. The core gameplay loop is simple and satisfying: Players dive to find artifacts, sell them at a pawn shop for cash, and use that money to buy better gear like faster flippers and larger oxygen tanks.

This straightforward progression allows players to dive deeper and access new areas, organically uncovering the mysteries of the lake, from submerged volcanoes to haunted pirate graveyards. Its greatest strength for beginners is this self-contained and crystal-clear objective, which teaches fundamental video game concepts like resource management and gear-gated progression without any pressure.

6 Pet Simulator 99

Collect, Hatch, and Trade Your Way Up

  • Creator: BIG Games
  • Game Link

Pet Simulator 99 drops players into a vibrant world and immediately hooks them with one of the most addictive gameplay loops on Roblox . The premise is simple: Click on giant piles of coins to earn currency, use that currency to hatch pets, and then equip those pets to break resource piles even faster. The feedback is instantaneous and gratifying, guiding new players toward their next unlock with zero friction.

However, this surface-level simplicity masks a deep and volatile player-driven trading economy. While clicking and collecting are easy to learn, players will quickly realize that meaningful advancement requires navigating a complex market to trade for powerful, mythical, or exclusive pets. Pet Simulator 99 is easy to learn but hard to master, proving to be a modern Roblox classic that can become quite addictive.

5 Hide and Seek Extreme

Hide, Seek, and Outsmart in Giant Rooms

  • Creator: Tim7775
  • Game Link

The childhood classic goes digital in Hide and Seek Extreme , delivering pure, instantly accessible fun. One player is “It,” and the rest scatter and hide in oversized, toy-themed maps, like kitchens, bedrooms, and living rooms blown up to playground size. The hiding spots are everywhere: behind books, under tables, or even through a few hidden passages.

What sets this game apart is that there are no tutorials, no complicated UI, because everyone already knows the rules. Players learn by doing, round after round, discovering clever new spots and perfecting the art of taunting or evading the Seeker. The game’s replayability is legendary, thanks to randomized maps and player powers, and the fast pace means even if players are found early, no one is sitting out for long.

4 Natural Disaster Survival​

Survive Anything in This Roblox Classic

  • Creator: stickmasterluke
  • Game Link

Natural Disaster Survival is a thrilling and foundational Roblox experience that throws a group of players onto an island and forces them to survive a series of random catastrophes. No items, no inventory, just instincts and quick thinking. The only goal is to stay alive when the disaster hits. There are no tutorials; learning is done through pure instinct and hilarious trial-and-error.

When a tsunami is announced, newcomers quickly learn to follow the other to the highest point. When an earthquake hits, they learn to run for open ground. As a “starter” game, Natural Disaster Survival is a masterclass in quick decision-making and situational awareness, all wrapped up in an endlessly replayable, low-pressure format.

3 Work at a Pizza Place

The Pizza-Making Teamwork Simulator

  • Creator: Dued1
  • Game Link

This legendary co-op game drops players into a busy pizzeria, where everyone picks a job—cashier, cook, delivery driver, supplier, or even manager. Every role matters. Miss a step, and the whole operation grinds to a halt. Work smoothly, and money is earned, allowing players to customize houses or get fun upgrades.

What makes it perfect for beginners? The roles are simple, instantly understandable, and structured for teamwork—no one is left out, and there’s always a clear objective. Watching the pizza assembly line come together, with total strangers collaborating toward a common goal, is pure Roblox magic.

2 Adopt Me!

Cute Pets, Big Trades, Endless Surprises

  • Creator: Uplift Games
  • Game Link

Few games capture Roblox ’s social spirit quite like Adopt Me! . Here, players raise and trade hundreds of adorable pets, decorate homes, complete daily tasks, and join in a bustling, ever-growing world called Adoption Island. The intuitive needs' system (feed the pet, play with them, keep them happy) is so welcoming that even young gamers or total newcomers can jump right in.

Adopt Me! is more than a pet simulator. It’s a lesson in collecting, goal-setting, and navigating a thriving player economy. The thrill of hatching rare pets, upgrading to Neonsand Mega-Neons, and trading with other fans keeps the loop addictive. With billions of visits and a community that’s always buzzing, Adopt Me! proves to be a top-tier intro to Roblox ’s culture, teaching both responsibility and the art of the deal.

1 Brookhaven RP

The Social Sandbox for Digital Daydreamers

  • Creator: Wolfpaq
  • Game Link

Brookhaven RP earns its top spot by being the purest expression of creative freedom on Roblox and, without question, the easiest game for a beginner to start playing. It’s the platform's biggest and ever-evolving sandbox. In Brookhaven , there are no levels, no grind, no currency walls. Players can instantly choose a stylish house, spawn a favorite car, and pick any job, all with a click.

Brookhaven ’s genius is its pure accessibility. Everything is intuitive and free, with the UI being built for instant immersion. The massive, friendly player base means there’s always someone to meet or join in a storyline with, and the constant updates keep the city buzzing with new secrets and content. For newcomers, it’s Roblox distilled. There's no stress or pressure - just creativity and a warm community.

item.title: Nintendo Switch Online Adds Classic Mario Game
item.description:
Nintendo has officially announced the release of Mario Paint on the Nintendo Switch Online service. This classic retro Mario title has been added to the Super Nintendo channel, and for those who don't already own a Nintendo Switch 2, it might require a peripheral to play. Nintendo Switch Online is a paid service which includes access to several retro Nintendo games for free, and the Super Nintendo channel is currently included with the basic digital subscription.

This marks the first Super Nintendo game added to Nintendo Switch Online since March 2025, and the first time a notable Mario title from the 16-bit era has been added to the service in years. As of late, the company has clearly been more focused on re-releasing popular Nintendo 64 and GameCube titles, so it's nice to see a cult classic first-party Mario title coming to the digital platform after several years of waiting.

After decades of being stuck on the Super Nintendo, the popular title Mario Paint is available on Nintendo Switch Online. This classic retro game required a mouse peripheral to play, which is undoubtedly one of the main reasons the company neglected to bring it back for so long. Thankfully, the Nintendo Switch 2 controller doubles as a mouse, allowing early adopters of the new console to play the game without needing an additional peripheral. That said, it's important to note that this game is also available to owners of the original Nintendo Switch, which is compatible with some brands of USB mouse.

Mario Paint Added to Nintendo Switch Online, New Trailer Reveals Details

In the reveal trailer for Mario Paint on Nintendo Switch Online, information is included to help gamers use the new mouse function on the Nintendo Switch 2. Although it's called Mario Paint , long-time fans of the game will recall that it also has a music composition feature which allows players to create music with various sounds from Nintendo's library. Not only will this feature return, but players will now be able to save musical creations by using suspend points. Better yet, the original music composed for this game can now be enjoyed on the Nintendo Music app.

While it might not be the most popular game in the franchise, Mario Paint has become legendary for inspiring both musical and digital artists for decades after its release. One of the more recent examples of this inspiration came in the form of a Mario Paint remake of the Succession theme from the popular HBO television show, but gamers have been using this title to re-create popular musical themes since it was first released in 1992. Now that the game is more accessible, hopefully gamers will find it easier than ever to create fun music and art with Mario Paint on Nintendo Switch Online.

item.title: Most Underrated PS2 Shooters, Ranked
item.description:
Summary

  • Red Dead Revolver offers incredibly fun shooting, even without open-world elements.
  • Killzone, despite comparisons to Halo, stands out with unique gameplay and pioneer of improved sequels.
  • Forbidden Siren may be challenging, but its peculiar mechanics and cult status make it worth a player's patience.

It's not uncommon for gamers to have, at some point, played a shooter that absolutely blew their minds and the way they look and play other games — then find out that very few other people know of said game. With how saturated the market is, it's inevitable that some great titles linger in obscurity.

The PlayStation 2 remains the highest-selling console of all time, and it features one of the largest gaming libraries to ever exist. With that in mind, it's understandable that a lot of great games would either fall through the cracks, or simply not hit the hearts and minds of critics when they first came out. Sometimes, they were ahead of their time. Let's look at some of the most underrated shooters in PS2 history.

7 Red Dead Revolver

The Makings Of A Classic

Red Dead Revolver
6.0 /10
Released
May 4, 2004

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
m
Developer(s)
Rockstar San Diego
Powered by

For anyone wondering why Red Dead Redemption has that name, it's because the people of Rockstar wanted to make a game that would "redeem" them from Red Dead Revolver . No redemption is needed, however, as the original Red Dead is quite a great game.

It might not have the awesome open world, but it doesn't need to rely on that to make its shooting incredibly fun. And, even though it falls short of reaching the heights of Red Dead Redemption , Revolver features a great multiplayer mode that its "sequel" sadly doesn't have.

6 Killzone

Almost There

Killzone
7.0 /10
Released
December 2, 2004

WHERE TO PLAY

PHYSICAL

ESRB
m
Developer(s)
Guerrilla Games, Supermassive Games
Powered by

Killzone was unlucky to get touted as the "Halo Killer ", but that was by the media, not by its devs. The good people at Guerrilla just wanted to make a good shooter, and that they did. Though both share a sci-fi setting, Killzone doesn't even look or play similarly to Halo, and that's a plus. Sadly, the original Killzone asked too much from the PS2's hardware, and ended up slouching a bit due to a few performance hiccups. Still, it remains a fun shooter that set the stage for a bunch of much-improved sequels.

5 Forbidden Siren

Forbidden Fun

  • Developer: Sony Computer Entertainment
  • Genre(s) : Horror, stealth, action
  • Release Date: November 6, 2003

Forbidden Siren , a game by some of the people behind Silent Hill , is a cult hit, but one that never managed to hit the mainstream quite as it deserved. While not a full-on shooter, it's known for its incredibly peculiar and hard-to-master shooting mechanics.

Horror games were still popular by the time of its release, and the names attached should have gotten the ball rolling for it to become a success, but it was just too challenging a game. Forbidden Siren was deliberately obtuse, and made even simple things like getting information out of a map a challenge. To give players an idea of just how punishing Forbidden Siren was, its own creator once tried to play the game and got killed just a few minutes into his campaign. Still, it's a great game that deserves anyone's time and patience.

4 Black

Incredible Particle Effects

Black
8.0 /10
Released
February 28, 2006

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ Due To Strong Language, Violence
Powered by

Black enjoyed immense levels of hype before release, as its previews showed a never-before-seen level of map destruction and particle effects. Black had incredible graphics and spectacular firefights. That made perfect sense, considering Black was made by the people behind the Burnout series at Criterion Games. Unfortunately, Black went, well, dark, shortly after release, and now remains a memory for the few people who enjoyed that action that seemed so far beyond everything the PlayStation 2 was supposed to pull off.

4:43
Related
Ranking The 8 Best Open-World Prequel Games

Great open-world games use their worlds to tell a rich, believable story, establishing a foundation for a future story in the game’s franchise

3 The Thing

An Overlooked Video Game Adaptation

Your comment has not been saved

Follow
Followed
The Thing
Survival Horror
Systems
9.6 /10
Released
August 21, 2002
ESRB
M
Developer(s)
Computer Artworks
Publisher(s)
VU Games, Konami

WHERE TO PLAY

PHYSICAL

Powered by

This game is based on a movie that's older than most of the people reading this article. The original The Thing is an undeniable classic nowadays, but it failed to resonate with audiences and critics when it came out.

Back in the early 2000s, someone decided to use the rep that the movie had acquired over the decades to make a video game adaptation. However, this also failed to leave the mark it should have. That's unfortunate, because, much like the movie, the game features a bunch of awesome elements that will surely succeed in getting players' levels of dread and paranoia all the way up to eleven. The Thing recently got a good remaster, so this is as good a time as any to experience this forgotten classic.

2 XIII

Cel-Shaded Peak

XIII
Action
First-Person Shooter
Systems
Released
November 10, 2020
ESRB
m
Developer(s)
PlayMagic

Powered by

Halo: Combat Evolved usually gets all the credit for making console shooters a genre to be reckoned with, and XIII was one of the first few games to follow in its footsteps. On top of playing beautifully on the PS2's controller, it features some really cool cel-shaded graphics that ensure the game will never feel dated.

Sadly, people only realized XIII's greatness much too late. Players only got not a sequel, but a remake nearly 20 years later in 2020. Sadly, it fails to measure up to the original. Here's hoping a better follow-up will arrive before 2040.

1 Red Faction

A Truly Revolutionary Title

Your comment has not been saved

Follow
Followed
Red Faction
FPS
Systems
9.0 /10
Released
May 22, 2001
ESRB
M For Mature 17+ due to Blood, Violence
Developer(s)
Volition
Publisher(s)
THQ

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Powered by

Red Faction puts players in the shoes of a miner in the midst of a proletariat revolution on Mars. Instead of having the character forget all about his day job to just grab whatever gun he can find and become every game's regular FPS protagonist, Red Faction has the main character honing in on his mining skills to save the day — as well as shooting a lot of incredibly fun guns.

Red Faction went on to get good reviews for its fun combat and original mechanics — which its sequel went on to completely drop. It's an absolute shame that such a great shooter, especially one in a time when console shooters weren't all that great, didn't get to grow in its sequels. The more recent sequels are great, but they're very different from the original title, which anyone should still give a shot today.

5:16

Let's look at some of the strangest, most mysterious, and most criminally underrated horror games in existence.

item.title: Best Dual Blades Build in Wuchang: Fallen Feathers
item.description:
Wuchang: Fallen Feathers gives players multiple weapon types that will greatly determine how they fight in combat. Respecing in this game is free and can be done at any time at a Shrine, incentivizing extensive testing of the various weapons, as the right build will make any weapon deal significant damage.

Dual Blades focuses on dealing damage with bursts of attacks that hit quickly but deal less damage per hit than most of the other weapon types in the game. Here is the best overall build for those using Dual Blades, including the optimal skills to utilize and the best stats to ensure you level up as frequently as possible.

Best Stats to Upgrade for Dual Swords in Wuchang: Fallen Feathers

By far the most important stat to focus on is Agility , with the second stat being Endurance. Agility will usually be the highest scaling stat on every Dual Blades weapon. Some Dual Blades weapons will have a second stat that scales the damage of the weapon, but the agility scaling will always be better, making it the better skill to focus on.

Fighting with Dual Blades will also require a lot of attacks and stamina to dish them out, making it important to have a high stamina pool . This weapon type will ultimately use the most stamina, but also offers a lot of ways to earn it back through combat.

Best Disciplines for Dual Blades in Wuchang: Fallen Feathers

There are multiple disciplines to choose from out of the Dual Blades skill tree, with others being tied to specific weapons. Of those out of the skill tree, you'll want to use either of the following:

  • Blade Master
  • Blade Dance

Blade Dance offers some decent crowd control, while still being a controlled enough combo to use against a boss. Blade Master's real appeal comes from the boost in your Clash efficiency , as clashing is a key aspect of this weapon type. While not disciplines, you'll want to make sure you get the Mighty Combination and Swift Warrior upgrades in the tree to boost your basic combos and get Skyborn Might.

Benedictions & Temperances for Dual Blades in Wuchang: Fallen Feathers

The most important Benedictions you can get for this weapon type are those that keep you alive, or those that boost your Clash in some way. You'll be Clashing a lot as you fight through enemy attacks, and your Benedictions should help you win out in those Clashes to let them give you more of an edge against your enemy.

Wisdom: Wei - Combo Force

Consecutive attacks increase your damage.

Oath: Bu - Skyborn Ward

Skyborn Might reduces damage taken for a time.

Oath: Bu - Blocking Clash

Increases the efficiency of clashes and blocks.

Memory: Sheng - Skyborn Rejuvenation

Gaining SKyborn Might grants Leech Life for a short time.

The goal of Dual Blades is to just focus on attacking as much as you can, and try to time your clashes as often as possible, but they will usually land on their own . Against most enemies, you'll win out in the exchange, and with the right buffs and damage, you'll quickly fill up an enemies' obliterate bar if not kill them outright.

For your Temperance, you'll either want one that hits the elemental weakness of the enemy or the Leech Life option . This weapon type will have a lot of exchanges in a fight, and having something that gives you health back naturally in those exchanges will help you stay up and at it during them.

8 Images
8 Images
